            ENVIRONMENTAL FRIENDLY ROAD CONSTRUCTIO,TF039447-BHUTAN - RURAL ACCESS ROADS PROJECT,TF037522-BHUTAN - RURAL ACCESS ROADS,TF034581-EGYPT - PVO SECTOR STUDY -

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Access Project aims to improve
            the access of rural communities to economic and social
            infrastructure, in order to improve the quality of life and
            productivity of rural communities. This two-volume
            environmental impact assessment report covers the components
            of i) Lhuntse-Dungkhar Road, and ii) Dakpai-Buli Road in
            Zhemgang. In both components, during the construction,
            landslides could be a threat if construction is executed in
            a traditional method. "Balance cut and fill,"
            which is an appropriate construction method for such
            landscape, will be adopted. Cut material which may roll down
            the slope and damage soil surface and vegetation will be
            reduced as much as possible. Grass seeding will also be used
            to protect the bare slopes. Traditional method of tipping
            down spoil material can cause forest cover to turn barren
            triggering landslides. This impact can be mitigated by using
            log barriers to retain spoil rolling down. Given the
            difficult topography, massive explosives will be used.
            Controlled blasting is identified as an appropriate method
            to be used. Adequate drainage will be provided to help make
            the roads durable.
